ABOUT_SECT.TITLE: About me
ABOUT_SECT.PGPH_2: mainly focused on the React ecosystem. I love building applications and products through clean and maintainable code.
ABOUT_SECT.PGPH_5: , where we are developing web sites for NGOs and foundations that help other people and don't have web presence.

IKODI.TITLE: IKodi
IKODI.DESCRIPTION: IKodi is my personal blog, where I share my knowledge writting posts about different tools, technologies and concepts related to the world of web development. With comment system included!

FULL_STACK_TODO.TITLE: Full-Stack To-Do
FULL_STACK_TODO.DESCRIPTION: The typical To-Do application, but integrating both client and server sides, with users authentication and data persistence with MongoDB.

MINECRAFT_CLONE.TITLE: Minecraft Clone
MINECRAFT_CLONE.DESCRIPTION: A fully functional Minecraft clone, based on the freeCodeCamp tutorial, using Three.js (a 2D/3D JavaScript library), React and TypeScript.

TIC_TAC_TOE.TITLE: Tic-Tac-Toe
TIC_TAC_TOE.DESCRIPTION: In this version of the well-known Tic-Tac-Toe, you can play versus the machine, store your points locally to play later, change players colors and some other funny features.

CONNECT_FOUR.TITLE: Connect Four
CONNECT_FOUR.DESCRIPTION: My version of the "Connect Four" game, implementing OOP with TypeScript and separating logic from view.

CRYPTO_ASSETS.TITLE: Crypto Assets
CRYPTO_ASSETS.DESCRIPTION: A simple dashboard to view your crypto address's transactions, with a minimalist design based on Material Design style guidelines.

SOFT_SKILLS_LIST.title: üìà Growth mindset
SOFT_SKILLS_LIST.content: I am always looking to innovate and grow as a person and professional.

SOFT_SKILLS_LIST.title: üöÄ Never stop learning
SOFT_SKILLS_LIST.content: I believe that learning is for life. I love learning from everyone about everything.

SOFT_SKILLS_LIST.title: üöÖ Quick adaptation to change
SOFT_SKILLS_LIST.content: Change is a good opportunity to see things in perspective and even change your approach.

SOFT_SKILLS_LIST.content: I like even break something to learn how does it work (don't worry, always in a separated branch üòâ).
